Detailed Description

Stores run-time type information (base class).

The classes TypeInfo and TypeInfoT store run-time type information (i.e., class name and parent class) and also maintain a static type database (a list of pointers to class TypeInfo). While the type database is built, the inheritance structure is also stored with it. Note: Multiple inheritance is not supported.

The procedure to build a type database is as follows:

  1. Each class has a static member s_typeInfo of class TypeInfoT
  2. At program start, all these static members are constructed.
  3. Each time a TypeInfoT object is constructed, it appends itself to the list of types
  4. At the point that main() is called, the type database is complete

To use the type information, either

  • use the s_typeInfo data member of an object to determine its type
  • use the type database to retrieve a list of all types (static functions of the TypeInfo class)

Example Program: 

//======================================================================== 
// Project: Robotic Platform
// ---------------------------------------------------------------------- 
// Package: Object Manager
// Authors: Markus Loffler
// Start Date: Mon Jan 22 17:34:23 utc 2001
// ----------------------------------------------------------------------  
// File: TypeInfo.t.cpp
// Example program for the classes TypeInfo and TypeInfoT
//char *objectNameierarchy, containing the
// classes PolygonBase, Polygon, FilledPolygon, and Box. Then, it
// demonstrates functions of the TypeInfo and TypeInfoT classes.
//========================================================================  
 

// ----- Standard Libaries -----
#include <iostream.h>

// ----- QRTS Libraries -----

// ----- Project Includes -----
#include "TypeInfo.hpp"
#include "TypeInfoT.hpp"


//======================================================================== 
// class PolygonBase
//========================================================================  

class PolygonBase
{
 public:
  PolygonBase(const char *objectName = 0) 
  {
    cout << "...PolygonBase constructor" << endl;
  }

 public:
  // Static data member to store the TypeInfo object
  static TypeInfoT<PolygonBase> s_typeInfo;
  
  // A virtual function to get a pointer to the static data member
  // This function must be in all derived class in the same syntax
  virtual const TypeInfo *getTypeInfo() const { return &s_typeInfo; }
  
  virtual void message() { cout << "You got the base class!" << endl; }
};

TypeInfoT<PolygonBase> PolygonBase::s_typeInfo("PolygonBase");

 
 
//======================================================================== 
// class Polygon
// -----------------------------------------------------------
// An example on how to use the TypeInfo with template classes
//========================================================================  

template <int numEdges>
class Polygon : public PolygonBase
{
 public:
  Polygon(const char *objectName = 0) : PolygonBase(objectName)
  {
    cout << "...Polygon<" << numEdges << "> constructor" << endl;
  }

 public:
  static TypeInfoT<Polygon> s_typeInfo;
  virtual const TypeInfo *getTypeInfo() const { return &s_typeInfo; }

  virtual void message()
    { cout << "I am a polygon with " << numEdges << " edges" << endl; }
};

template <int numEdges>
TypeInfoT<Polygon<numEdges> >
  Polygon<numEdges>::s_typeInfo("Polygon", numEdges, "PolygonBase");

 
 
//======================================================================== 
// class FilledPolygon: A filled polygon is a special kind of polygon
// ------------------------------------------------------------------
// An example on how to use the TypeInfo with template classes
// that are derived from template classes
//========================================================================  

template <int numEdges>
class FilledPolygon : public Polygon<numEdges>
{
 public:
  FilledPolygon(const char *objectName = 0) : Polygon<numEdges>(objectName)
  {
    cout << "...FilledPolygon<" << numEdges << "> constructor" << endl;
  }
 
 public:
  static TypeInfoT<FilledPolygon> s_typeInfo;
  virtual const TypeInfo *getTypeInfo() const { return &s_typeInfo; }

  virtual void message()
    { cout << "I am a filled polygon with " << numEdges << " edges" << endl; }
};

template <int numEdges>
TypeInfoT<FilledPolygon<numEdges> >
  FilledPolygon<numEdges>::s_typeInfo("FilledPolygon", numEdges,
                                      "Polygon", numEdges);

 
//======================================================================== 
// class Box: A box is a polygon with 4 edges
// --------------------------------------------------
// An example on how to use the TypeInfo with classes
// that are derived from template classes
//========================================================================  

class Box : public FilledPolygon<4>
{
 public:
  Box(const char *objectName = 0) : FilledPolygon<4>(objectName)
  {
    cout << "...Box constructor" << endl;
  }
  
 public:
  static TypeInfoT<Box> s_typeInfo;
  virtual const TypeInfo *getTypeInfo() const { return &s_typeInfo; }

  virtual void message() { cout << "Hello, I am a box" << endl; }
};
 
TypeInfoT<Box> Box::s_typeInfo("Box", "FilledPolygon<4>");


 
//======================================================================== 
// main
//========================================================================  
 
int main()
{
  Polygon<6> p6;
  FilledPolygon<3> triangle;
  Box myBox;
  
  cout << endl;
  cout << "There are " << TypeInfo::getNumTypes()
       << " types in the type database." << endl << endl;
  
  TypeInfo::listAllTypes(cout);
  cout << endl;
  
  cout << "triangle has the type " << triangle.getTypeInfo()->getClassName()
       << endl;
       
  PolygonBase *polygon = (PolygonBase *)
    myBox.getTypeInfo()->getParent()->createObject();
  
  cout << "*polygon has the type" << polygon->getTypeInfo()->getClassName()
       << endl;

  cout << "parent class of Box is " 
       << TypeInfo::getTypeByName("Box")->getParentClassName()
       << endl << endl;;
  
  cout << "Please input a type name: ";
  char typeName[100];
  cin >> typeName;
  
  const TypeInfo *type = TypeInfo::getTypeByName(typeName);
  if (type == 0)
    cout << "Type " << typeName << " does not exist in the program!" << endl;
  else
  {
    PolygonBase *userType = (PolygonBase *) type->createObject();
    userType->message();
  }
  
  return 0;
}


/* --------------- Program Output --------------- 

...PolygonBase constructor
...Polygon<6> constructor
...PolygonBase constructor
...Polygon<3> constructor
...FilledPolygon<3> constructor
...PolygonBase constructor
...Polygon<4> constructor
...FilledPolygon<4> constructor
...Box constructor

There are 7 types in the type database.

Type Database:
- PolygonBase
- Box                (derived from FilledPolygon<4>)
- FilledPolygon<3>   (derived from Polygon<3>)
- Polygon<3>         (derived from PolygonBase)
- Polygon<6>         (derived from PolygonBase)
- FilledPolygon<4>   (derived from Polygon<4>)
- Polygon<4>         (derived from PolygonBase)

triangle has the type FilledPolygon<3>
...PolygonBase constructor
...Polygon<4> constructor
...FilledPolygon<4> constructor
*polygon has the typeFilledPolygon<4>
parent class of Box is FilledPolygon<4>

Please input a type name: Box
...PolygonBase constructor
...Polygon<4> constructor
...FilledPolygon<4> constructor
...Box constructor
Hello, I am a box
------------------------------------------------*/

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

TypeInfo ( )
 

Constructor.

~TypeInfo ( ) [virtual]
 

Destructor.

Member Function Documentation

const char * getClassName ( ) const
 

Returns the class name of the type.

Returns:
The class name, including template <...> part.

bool isClass ( const char * className ) const
 

Returns if the type has a certain class name.

Parameters:
className   The class name to check
Returns:
true: The class name matches, false: The class name does not match.

const char * getParentClassName ( ) const
 

Returns the class name of the parent class.

Returns:
The class name, including template <...> part.

const TypeInfo * getParent ( ) const
 

Returns a pointer to the type info of the parent class.

Returns:
A pointer to the type info of the parent class, 0 if this is a root class.

bool isDerivedFromClass ( TypeInfo * baseClassTypeInfo ) const
 

Checks if the type is derived from a certain class.

Parameters:
baseClassTypeInfo   The type info of the base class to check.
Returns:
true: The type is derived from baseClassName, false: The type is not derived from baseClassName

Example: 

     Car toyota;
     if (toyata.getTypeInfo().isDerivedFromClass(Vehicle::s_typeInfo)
       cout << "Object toyota's class is derived from class Vehicle" << endl;

void * createObject ( ) const [pure virtual]
 

Creates a new object of the type, using the default constructor. This is the same as "new Type".

Returns:
A pointer to the new object.

Reimplemented in TypeInfoAbstractT, and TypeInfoT.

void * createObject ( const char * objectName ) const [pure virtual]
 

Creates a new object of the type, using the constructor that takes one argument of type objectName. This is the same as "new Type(objectName)".

Parameters:
objectName   Object name, is passed to the constructor.
Returns:
A pointer to the new object.

Reimplemented in TypeInfoAbstractT, and TypeInfoT.

bool isAbstractClass ( ) const [pure virtual]
 

Determines if the type info describes an abstract class.

Returns:
true: class is abstract, false: class is not abstract.

Reimplemented in TypeInfoAbstractT, and TypeInfoT.

int getNumTypes ( ) [static]
 

Returns the number of types in the type database

Returns:
The number of types in the type database.

const TypeInfo * getTypeByIndex ( int index ) [static]
 

Returns a type of the type database, specfyied by its index.

Parameters:
index   The index of the type in the type database
Returns:
A pointer to the type, or 0 if index was out of range.

const TypeInfo * getTypeByName ( const char * name ) [static]
 

Returns a type of the type database, specfyied by its name.

Parameters:
name   Name of the type, including template parameter (<...>).
Returns:
A pointer to the type, or 0 if name was not found.

void listAllTypes ( ostream & outputStream = cout ) [static]
 

This is a debugging function. It lists all currently registered types of the type database. outputStream The output stream for the output.
